vignette.name: Assistance for Inlets and Outlets
vignette.bodytext: One useful way to document abstractions and subpatchers is to add assistance text to inlet and outlet objects. Once you document and inlet or outlet, the assistance shows up in a bubble or in the Patcher window's Status Bar when you move the mouse over an inlet or outlet object.

bluebox.header2: Adding assistance to an abstraction or subpatcher

ul.li: Select an inlet or outlet object in your abstraction or subpatcher. Click the Inspector button on the Patcher toolbar to show the object's Inspector.
Double-click in the Value column for the Comment setting to show a cursor and text box.

Type in the assistance string information followed by a carriage return. The Value column will be de-selected, and you will see your text when you position your cursor over the inlet or outlet in any patcher that contains your abstraction if you have Assistance enabled.
